name: procure
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ T ] to get something, especially after an effort: She's managed somehow to procure his phone number. [ + two objects ] He'd procured us seats in the front row.
[ I or T ] to get a prostitute for someone else to have sex with

to obtain something, esp. after an effort: We procured maps and directions from the tourist office. procurement noun [ U ] us
Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/prəˈkjʊr·mənt, proʊ-/
the city’s procurement process
Add to word list
Add to word list
to get something, especially when it involves effort: procure capital/funds/financing Low interest rates support bonds by making it cheaper for investors to procure funds and invest in fixed-income securities. A small car manufacturer may produce its own engines, but it may also procure them from a larger firm.
